title: Market up on open but WiseTech punishment continues
text:
William McInnes

Morgans increased its price target on JB Hi-Fi by 19.6 per cent after the company's first quarter trading update showed an acceleration in same store sales (SSS) growth across all three divisions.

The broker retained its 'hold' rating on the company but lifted its price target from $29.55 to $35.34.

The broker suggested JB Hi-Fi's reiterated fiscal 2020 sales guidance was conservative, but noted the performance over the Christmas trading period was key.

"With the store rollout now mature, JB Hi-Fi’s growth profile becomes significantly more skewed to SSS growth, managing various product category margins and balancing online/bricks-and-mortar investment in a changing consumer environment," said analyst Josephine Little.

"[Thursday's] solid SSS update was accordingly rewarded by the market, with JBH providing quality exposure to a potentially recovering Australian consumer backdrop."
description: Morgans ups JB Hi-Fi price target, market jumps on open but WiseTech takes another hit.
